channel.title: Daily Express :: World Feed
channel.description: Simply The Best 7 Days A Week

item.title: Spain's beautiful city that's begging for more tourists
item.description: Located just over an hour on the high-speed train from either Madrid or Barcelona, the city hasn't seen any overtourism protests so far.
item.author: Astha Saxena
item.media:keywords: Europe, Spain, Cities, Tourism, Overtourism, Spain city begging for tourists, Spain underrated city, Spain hidden gem, Spain least crowded city

media:content.media:description: Zaragoza is the capital of the eastern region of Aragon

media:thumbnail.media:description: Zaragoza is the capital of the eastern region of Aragon

item.title: The little country building the world's biggest mega-port - and it's going to cost Â£10bn
item.description: A tiny Asian country will soon be home to the largest port in the world as a £10 billion project gets underway.
item.author: Brian Dillon
item.media:keywords: Asia, Infrastructure, mega project, Singapore, port, Tuas Mega Port

media:content.media:description: Tuas Mega Port is expected to be fully open by the 2040s.

media:thumbnail.media:description: Tuas Mega Port is expected to be fully open by the 2040s.

item.title: The world's longest 510 miles straight road - no twists and takes over 8 hours to drive
item.description: The road passes through desert regions with barely any buildings, trees or traffic, just flat, dry landscape and endless tarmac.
item.author: Kris Boratyn
item.media:keywords: Saudi Arabia, Road trip, Motorway, Highway 85, Longest straight road, Desert landscape, world's longest straight road, the longest straight road in the world, longest straight roads in the world, motorways in Saudi Arabia , motorways in Saudi Arabia

media:content.media:description: Saudi Arabia is home to some of the world's longest straight roads.

media:thumbnail.media:description: Saudi Arabia is home to some of the world's longest straight roads.

item.title: Heartbreaking pictures show devastating aftermath of deadly floods which killed 27
item.description: State authorities have confirmed that between 23 and 25 girls from Camp Mystic are still unaccounted for.
item.author: Ciaran McGrath
item.media:keywords: Flood, Missing persons, Texas, Texas floods, Camp Mystic, Guadalupe River, missing campers

media:content.media:description: A plush toy sits on the ground outside of a cabin at Camp Mystic

media:thumbnail.media:description: A plush toy sits on the ground outside of a cabin at Camp Mystic

item.title: Inside the eerie town where residents live underground to escape killer 55C heat
item.description: To avoid the killer high temperatures of up to 55C, the majority of this town's 2,500 residents now live underground.
item.author: Emily Wright
item.media:keywords: Australia, Towns, Hot weather, Tourism, Coober Pedy, underground living, extreme heat, opal mining, dugouts, 55C, £132000 property , fanily home, two bathrooms, not much rain, ventilation shafts, solar energy, underground churches, Crocodile Dundee, £132000 property

media:content.media:description: To avoid the killer high temperatures, the majority of this town's residents live underground.

media:thumbnail.media:description: To avoid the killer high temperatures, the majority of this town's residents live underground.

item.title: Archaeology breakthrough as shipwreck with 2,000 year old items leaves scientists shocked
item.description: The discovery of an incredible ancient shipwreck containing 2,000-year-old artefacts has been described as significant for "world cultural heritage".
item.author: Emily Wright
item.media:keywords: Archaeology, Shipwrecks, Turkey, Antalya, Ancient Shipwreck, Adrasan Coast, Ceramic Artefacts, Maritime Trade Networks, Late Hellenistic-Early Roman, 2000 years ago, original stacked arrangement, pristine condition, protective raw clay coating

media:content.media:description: Archaeology breakthrough as shipwreck containing 2,000-year-old items leaves scientists baffled TAK
media:content.media:credit: MINISTRY OF CULTURE AND TOURISM OF THE REPUBLIC OF TURKEY

media:thumbnail.media:description: Archaeology breakthrough as shipwreck containing 2,000-year-old items leaves scientists baffled TAK

item.title: Genetically modified dire wolves brought back from extinction have 'doubled in size'
item.description: A new video suggests the only months genetically engineered pups have grown considerably.
item.author: Chris Samuel
item.media:keywords: Animals, Science (section), dire wolf, dire wolves, science, scientists, double in size, Dire wolves, Genetic engineering, Colossal Biosciences, Ancient DNA, De-extinction

media:content.media:description: The genetically modified creatures have grown considerably in size.

media:thumbnail.media:description: The genetically modified creatures have grown considerably in size.

item.title: The harrowing site where 900 people died now to become a dark tourism hotspot
item.description: The site of a horrific cult massacre, which saw the deaths of over 900 people, has been controversially opened to tourists.
item.author: Joshua Whorms,Emily Wright
item.media:keywords: Tourism, South America, Religion, Jonestown massacre, dark tourism, Jim Jones, Guyana, 900 died, Wanderlust Adventures GY, £550 package deal, money grab, November 1978, Kit Nascimento, John Cobb, Leo Ryan, revolutionary suicide, tourist attraction

media:content.media:description: The site of a horrific cult massacre, which saw the deaths of over 900 people, has been opened.

media:thumbnail.media:description: The site of a horrific cult massacre, which saw the deaths of over 900 people, has been opened.

item.title: Four dead as German aircraft crashes in Austrian Alps
item.description: Initial reports suggest the plane may have been a motorised glider, although that has not yet been confirmed.
item.author: Ciaran McGrath
item.media:keywords: Aircraft, Alpine, Austria, Germany, German plane crash, Austrian Alps, aviation investigation, Oberschleissheim departure

item.title: Sunken UK warship is a 'ticking timebomb' which could unleash catastrophe
item.description: HMS Cassandra is one of an estimated 8,500 wrecks around the world posing serious environmental risks.
item.author: Ciaran McGrath
item.media:keywords: Royal Navy, Environmental Issues, Baltic states, HMS Cassandra, Baltic Sea, environmental risk, Project Tangaroa

media:content.media:description: The wreck of HMS Cassandra lies on the bed of the Baltic Sea
